Tree spirits are monsters which can be found in the Enchanted Valley using the fairy ring code bkq when attempting to cut down a tree. Because of the common nature rune drops supplemented by drops of rune and adamant axes and various seeds, tree spirits can be good money, although not much experience will be gained. The tree spirit's combat level varies depending on that of the player's, a minimum of 14, and up to a maximum of level 159.

Tree Spirit Combat Level Player Combat Level
14 3-10
29 11 - 20
49 21 - 40
79 41 - 60
120 61- 90
159 91+

Unlike the tree spirit fought in the Lost City quest, these tree spirits are not undead; therefore they are not affected by Crumble Undead or the effects of the salve amulet and its variants. Magic is effective versus them because their Magic level does not increase as their combat level and other combat stats do. They can also be easily safespotted using the plants near the trees cut to spawn them.

Tree spirits are notable for being a fairly easy method for Ironmen obtaining a rune axe, as well as being an efficient method of obtaining Nature Runes for low-to-mid level players as the spirits drop 5.578 nature runes on average per kill.

Contents

  • 1 History
  • 2 Drops
    • 2.1 Weapons and armour
    • 2.2 Runes
    • 2.3 Herbs
    • 2.4 Seeds
    • 2.5 Other
    • 2.6 Rare drop table
  • 3 Changes
  • 4 References

History[edit | edit source]

Before the random event update in 2014, the tree spirit used to appear randomly when attempting to cut a tree. On appearance, it would say "Leave these woods and never return!". As with similar guardian random events, the tree spirit's combat level and stats scaled with the player's combat level, as well as only being attackable by the targeted player.

As with all other aggressive random events, it was removed in an update.

Drops[edit | edit source]

Drop rates estimated based on 2,040,192 kills from the Drop Rate Project, unless otherwise cited.

The average Tree spirit kill is worth 2,683.

Date Changes
29 March 2004
(update)

The NPC was permanently added with the launch of RuneScape 2.

2 February 2004
(update)

The NPC was added to the RuneScape 2 Beta.

'''Tree spirits''' are [[monster]]s which can be found in the [[Enchanted Valley]] using the [[Fairy rings|fairy ring]] code {{Fairycode|bkq}} when attempting to cut down a [[Tree (Enchanted Valley)|tree]]. Because of the common [[nature rune]] [[drops]] supplemented by drops of [[Rune axe|rune]] and [[adamant axe]]s and various [[seeds]], tree spirits can be good money, although not much [[experience]] will be gained. The tree spirit's [[combat level]] varies depending on that of the player's, a minimum of 14, and up to a maximum of level 159.

Unlike the tree spirit fought in the [[Lost City]] [[Quests|quest]], these tree spirits are not [[undead]]; therefore they are not affected by [[Crumble Undead]] or the effects of the [[salve amulet]] and its variants. Magic is effective versus them because their Magic level does not increase as their combat level and other combat stats do. They can also be easily safespotted using the plants near the trees cut to spawn them.

Tree spirits are notable for being a fairly easy method for [[Ironman Mode|Ironmen]] obtaining a rune axe, as well as being an efficient method of obtaining [[Nature rune|Nature Runes]] for low-to-mid level players as the spirits drop {{formatnum:{{#expr:(22*31+10*2+5*2+2)/128 round 3}}}} nature runes on average per kill.

==History==
Before the [[random events|random event]] update in [[2014]], the tree spirit used to appear randomly when attempting to cut a [[trees|tree]]. On appearance, it would say "Leave these woods and never return!". As with similar guardian random events, the tree spirit's [[combat level]] and stats scaled with the player's combat level, as well as only being attackable by the targeted player.

As with all other aggressive random events, it was removed in an [[Update:Optional Randoms & Goblins|update]].
